text: IME passive inner ear actually gives you more bang for your buck purely in terms of quietening things down, but the other gripes I have with them outweigh that advantage
ie, my plantronics don't blow out of my ears if there's a wind, one of the phones doesn't slip slightly out of position unbalancing the stereo slightly, etc
<@U04BD6KB1> looking forward to your talk. Are you gonna touch on the state of RethingDB?

Yeah well actually I'm reshaping it quite a bit; I'm going to touch briefly on Horizon/Rethink along with my `ember-horizon` addon but then the rest will be talking about Firebase as a real-time DB interacting with Ember through Redux (and my my `ember-redux-core` addon)
Personally I'm hoping to see some traction in the open source community on RethinkDB post-announcement but the Slack channel hasn't given me confidence yet

<@U06BGNMBL> I'm pretty happy with the Jaybird x2's ... very good quality audio, reasonably good noise cancellation, great price-to-performance ratio. That said, there is a richness in sound I haven't found in the inner ears that I get from higher-end over the ears. I LOVE my v-moda over the ears but they are wired so I don't use them that much.

People seem really hung up on the license, which is understandable I guess. I hope it gets picked up by apache or something. It would be a shame if it dies a slow death after this, I would still like to choose an open source realtime db over firebase, but it would definitely have to be actively maintained.
yes I'm completely with you on preferring open-source but I can't afford to pick a stillborn ... I think we need to wait out the next month or two to really know where this will end
I'm still secretly hoping that someone like Microsoft will bless this project as that's all it would take and I think Microsoft could get a lot marketing miles out of it too
<@U06BGNMBL> oh last thing, they have wingtips which help it stay in your ear; i use them for running and find them pretty reliable for "staying in"
everything ends up in the Apache graveyard
although CouchDB seem to be doing quite well over there
<@U0ASPMFPS> thanks for bringing in your sunny disposition :stuck_out_tongue:
